translations.chinese: 管叔鮮、蔡叔度者，周文王子而武王弟也。
translations.literal: Guan Shu Xian and Cai Shu Du were sons of King Wen of Zhou and younger brothers of King Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Guan Shu Xian and Cai Shu Du were sons of King Wen of Zhou and younger brothers of King Wu.

context.next: 武王同母兄弟十人。

translations.chinese: 武王同母兄弟十人。
translations.literal: King Wu had ten brothers from the same mother.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu had ten brothers from the same mother.

context.previous: 管叔鮮、蔡叔度者，周文王子而武王弟也。
context.next: 母曰太姒，文王正妃也。

translations.chinese: 母曰太姒，文王正妃也。
translations.literal: Their mother was called Tai Si, King Wen's principal consort.
translations.idiomatic: Their mother was called Tai Si, King Wen's principal consort.

context.previous: 武王同母兄弟十人。
context.next: 其長子曰伯邑考，次曰武王發，次曰管叔鮮，次曰周公旦，次曰蔡叔度，次曰曹叔振鐸，次曰成叔武，次曰霍叔處，次曰康叔封，次曰冉季載。

translations.chinese: 其長子曰伯邑考，次曰武王發，次曰管叔鮮，次曰周公旦，次曰蔡叔度，次曰曹叔振鐸，次曰成叔武，次曰霍叔處，次曰康叔封，次曰冉季載。
translations.literal: Their eldest son was called Bo Yi Kao, next was King Wu Fa, next was Guan Shu Xian, next was the Duke of Zhou Dan, next was Cai Shu Du, next was Cao Shu Zhen Duo, next was Cheng Shu Wu, next was Huo Shu Chu, next was Kang Shu Feng, next was Ran Ji Zai.
translations.idiomatic: Their eldest son was called Bo Yi Kao, next was King Wu Fa, next was Guan Shu Xian, next was the Duke of Zhou Dan, next was Cai Shu Du, next was Cao Shu Zhen Duo, next was Cheng Shu Wu, next was Huo Shu Chu, next was Kang Shu Feng, next was Ran Ji Zai.

context.previous: 母曰太姒，文王正妃也。
context.next: 冉季載最少。

translations.chinese: 冉季載最少。
translations.literal: Ran Ji Zai was the youngest.
translations.idiomatic: Ran Ji Zai was the youngest.

context.previous: 其長子曰伯邑考，次曰武王發，次曰管叔鮮，次曰周公旦，次曰蔡叔度，次曰曹叔振鐸，次曰成叔武，次曰霍叔處，次曰康叔封，次曰冉季載。
context.next: 同母昆弟十人，唯發、旦賢，左右輔文王，故文王舍伯邑考而以發為太子。

translations.chinese: 同母昆弟十人，唯發、旦賢，左右輔文王，故文王舍伯邑考而以發為太子。
translations.literal: The ten brothers from the same mother, only Fa and Dan were worthy. They assisted King Wen on left and right, so King Wen abandoned Bo Yi Kao and made Fa his crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Thus he enfeoffed Shu Xian at Guan, enfeoffed Shu Du at Cai: the two supervised Zhou Zi Wu Geng Lu Fu, governing the remaining Yin people.

context.previous: 冉季載最少。
context.next: 及文王崩而發立，是為武王。

translations.chinese: 及文王崩而發立，是為武王。
translations.literal: When King Wen passed away, Fa ascended and became King Wu.
translations.idiomatic: He enfeoffed Shu Dan at the old capital of Shao Hao, Qu Fu, making him the Duke of Zhou.

context.previous: 同母昆弟十人，唯發、旦賢，左右輔文王，故文王舍伯邑考而以發為太子。
context.next: 伯邑考既已前卒矣。

translations.chinese: 伯邑考既已前卒矣。
translations.literal: Bo Yi Kao had already died previously.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou did not take up his enfeoffment, remaining to assist King Wu.

context.previous: 及文王崩而發立，是為武王。

translations.chinese: 武王已克殷紂，平天下，封功臣昆弟。
translations.literal: King Wu had already conquered Yin Zhou and pacified the world, enfeoffing meritorious ministers and his brothers.
translations.idiomatic: To reward the Duke of Zhou, he enfeoffed Shu Zhen Duo at Cao, enfeoffed Shu Wu at Cheng, enfeoffed Shu Chu at Huo.

context.next: 於是封叔鮮於管，封叔度於蔡：二人相紂子武庚祿父，治殷遺民。

translations.chinese: 於是封叔鮮於管，封叔度於蔡：二人相紂子武庚祿父，治殷遺民。
translations.literal: Therefore enfeoffed Shu Xian at Guan, enfeoffed Shu Du at Cai: two people assisted Zhou son Wu Geng Lu Fu, governed Yin remnant people.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore he enfeoffed Shu Xian at Guan and Shu Du at Cai: the two assisted Zhou's son Wu Geng Lu Fu and governed Yin's remnant people.

context.previous: 武王已克殷紂，平天下，封功臣昆弟。
context.next: 封叔旦於魯而相周，為周公。

translations.chinese: 封叔旦於魯而相周，為周公。
translations.literal: He enfeoffed Shu Dan at Lu and he assisted Zhou, becoming the Duke of Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu had already died, King Cheng was young, the Duke of Zhou monopolized the royal house.

context.previous: 於是封叔鮮於管，封叔度於蔡：二人相紂子武庚祿父，治殷遺民。
context.next: 封叔振鐸於曹，封叔武於成，封叔處於霍。

translations.chinese: 封叔振鐸於曹，封叔武於成，封叔處於霍。
translations.literal: He enfeoffed Shu Zhen Duo at Cao, Shu Wu at Cheng, and Shu Chu at Huo.
translations.idiomatic: Guan Shu and Cai Shu suspected the Duke of Zhou, thus joined with Wu Geng in rebellion, desiring to attack Cheng Zhou.

context.previous: 封叔旦於魯而相周，為周公。
context.next: 康叔封、冉季載皆少，未得封。

translations.chinese: 康叔封、冉季載皆少，未得封。
translations.literal: Kang Shu Feng and Ran Ji Zai were both young and had not yet obtained enfeoffments.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou Dan used the Son of Heaven's command to dispatch troops and punish them, executed Wu Geng, exiled Guan Shu, killed Cai Shu, with seven chariots and seventy foot soldiers enfeoffed Shu Du at Cai.

context.previous: 封叔振鐸於曹，封叔武於成，封叔處於霍。

translations.chinese: 武王既崩，成王少，周公旦專王室。
translations.literal: King Wu had already passed away. King Cheng was young, and the Duke of Zhou Dan monopolized the royal chamber.
translations.idiomatic: To maintain Cai Shu's sacrifices, thus Cai Shu maintained the sacrifices.

context.next: 管叔、蔡叔疑周公之為不利於成王，乃挾武庚以作亂。

translations.chinese: 管叔、蔡叔疑周公之為不利於成王，乃挾武庚以作亂。
translations.literal: Guan Shu, Cai Shu doubted Zhou Gong's doing harmful to Cheng Wang, then took Wu Geng to make rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: Guan Shu and Cai Shu doubted that the Duke of Zhou's actions were harmful to King Cheng, so they took Wu Geng and made rebellion.

context.previous: 武王既崩，成王少，周公旦專王室。
context.next: 周公旦承成王命伐誅武庚，殺管叔，而放蔡叔，遷之，與車十乘，徒七十人從。

translations.chinese: 周公旦承成王命伐誅武庚，殺管叔，而放蔡叔，遷之，與車十乘，徒七十人從。
translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou Dan received King Cheng's command to attack and execute Wu Geng, kill Guan Shu, and banish Cai Shu. He moved him and gave him ten chariots with seventy followers.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou Dan received King Cheng's command to attack and execute Wu Geng, kill Guan Shu, and banish Cai Shu. He moved him and gave him ten chariots with seventy followers.

context.previous: 管叔、蔡叔疑周公之為不利於成王，乃挾武庚以作亂。
context.next: 而分殷餘民為二：其一封微子啟於宋，以續殷祀；

translations.chinese: 而分殷餘民為二：其一封微子啟於宋，以續殷祀；
translations.literal: And divided Yin remnant people into two: one enfeoffed Wei Zi Qi at Song, to continue Yin sacrifices;
translations.idiomatic: And he divided Yin's remnant people into two: one he enfeoffed Wei Zi Qi at Song to continue Yin's sacrifices;

context.previous: 周公旦承成王命伐誅武庚，殺管叔，而放蔡叔，遷之，與車十乘，徒七十人從。
context.next: 其一封康叔為衛君，是為衛康叔。

translations.chinese: 其一封康叔為衛君，是為衛康叔。
translations.literal: The other he enfeoffed Kang Shu as lord of Wei, who became Wei Kang Shu.
translations.idiomatic: Thirty-eight years, Lu first appeared, enfeoffed at Lu.

context.previous: 而分殷餘民為二：其一封微子啟於宋，以續殷祀；
context.next: 封季載於冉。

translations.chinese: 封季載於冉。
translations.literal: He enfeoffed Ji Zai at Ran.
translations.idiomatic: He enfeoffed Ji Zai at Ran.

context.previous: 其一封康叔為衛君，是為衛康叔。
context.next: 冉季、康叔皆有馴行，於是周公舉康叔為周司寇，冉季為周司空，以佐成王治，皆有令名於天下。

translations.chinese: 冉季、康叔皆有馴行，於是周公舉康叔為周司寇，冉季為周司空，以佐成王治，皆有令名於天下。
translations.literal: Ran Ji and Kang Shu both had gentle conduct. Therefore the Duke of Zhou raised Kang Shu to be Zhou's Minister of Crime, and Ran Ji to be Zhou's Minister of Works, to assist King Cheng in governing. They all had good reputations throughout the world.
translations.idiomatic: Fifty-five years, the king was about to cast the yellow axe, summoned Kang Shu as Sikou.

context.previous: 封季載於冉。

translations.chinese: 蔡叔度既遷而死。
translations.literal: Cai Shu Du, having been moved, died.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Bo Kun died, made Kang Shu's grandson Kang Bo, nineteen years, Kang Bo died.

context.next: 其子曰胡，胡乃改行，率德馴善。

translations.chinese: 其子曰胡，胡乃改行，率德馴善。
translations.literal: His son was called Hu. Hu then changed his conduct, leading virtue and being gentle and good.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Shu's great-grandson was called Kang Bo Yin.

context.previous: 蔡叔度既遷而死。
context.next: 周公聞之，而舉胡以為魯卿士，魯國治。

translations.chinese: 周公聞之，而舉胡以為魯卿士，魯國治。
translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou heard of it and raised Hu to be a minister in Lu. The state of Lu was well governed.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou heard of it and raised Hu to be a minister in Lu. The state of Lu was well governed.

context.previous: 其子曰胡，胡乃改行，率德馴善。
context.next: 於是周公言於成王，復封胡於蔡，以奉蔡叔之祀，是為蔡仲。

translations.chinese: 於是周公言於成王，復封胡於蔡，以奉蔡叔之祀，是為蔡仲。
translations.literal: Therefore Zhou Gong spoke to Cheng Wang, again enfeoffed Hu at Cai, to continue Cai Shu's sacrifices, this was Cai Zhong.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the Duke of Zhou spoke to King Cheng and again enfeoffed Hu at Cai to continue Cai Shu's sacrifices. This was Cai Zhong.

context.previous: 周公聞之，而舉胡以為魯卿士，魯國治。
context.next: 餘五叔皆就國，無為天子吏者。

translations.chinese: 餘五叔皆就國，無為天子吏者。
translations.literal: The remaining five uncles all went to their states and none became officials of the Son of Heaven.
translations.idiomatic: Thirty-three years, Kang Bo Kun died.

context.previous: 於是周公言於成王，復封胡於蔡，以奉蔡叔之祀，是為蔡仲。

translations.chinese: 蔡仲卒，子蔡伯荒立。
translations.literal: Cai Zhong died, and his son Cai Bo Huang ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Thirty-seven years, Kang Bo Kun died.

context.next: 蔡伯荒卒，子宮侯立。

translations.chinese: 蔡伯荒卒，子宮侯立。
translations.literal: Cai Bo Huang died, and his son Gong Hou ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Shu's great-great-grandson was called Kang Bo Dan.

context.previous: 蔡仲卒，子蔡伯荒立。
context.next: 宮侯卒，子厲侯立。

translations.chinese: 宮侯卒，子厲侯立。
translations.literal: Gong Hou died, and his son Duke Li ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Forty-one years, Kang Bo Dan died.

context.previous: 蔡伯荒卒，子宮侯立。
context.next: 厲侯卒，子武侯立。

translations.chinese: 厲侯卒，子武侯立。
translations.literal: Duke Li died, and his son Duke Wu ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Shu's great-grandson was called Kang Bo Song.

context.previous: 宮侯卒，子厲侯立。
context.next: 武侯之時，周厲王失國，奔彘，共和行政，諸侯多叛周。

translations.chinese: 武侯之時，周厲王失國，奔彘，共和行政，諸侯多叛周。
translations.literal: In Duke Wu's time, King Li of Zhou lost his state and fled to Zhi. The Gong He administered the government, and many feudal lords rebelled against Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Wu's time, King Li of Zhou lost his state and fled to Zhi. The Gong He administered the government, and many feudal lords rebelled against Zhou.

context.previous: 厲侯卒，子武侯立。

translations.chinese: 武侯卒，子夷侯立。
translations.literal: Duke Wu died, and his son Duke Yi ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Shu's great-great-grandson was called Kang Bo Jiao.

context.next: 夷侯十一年，周宣王即位。

translations.chinese: 夷侯十一年，周宣王即位。
translations.literal: In Duke Yi's eleventh year, King Xuan of Zhou ascended the throne.
translations.idiomatic: Sixty-one years, Kang Bo Jiao died.

context.previous: 武侯卒，子夷侯立。
context.next: 二十八年，夷侯卒，子釐侯所事立。

translations.chinese: 二十八年，夷侯卒，子釐侯所事立。
translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, Duke Yi died, and his son Duke Xi Suo Shi ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Shu's great-great-grandson was called Kang Bo Xie.

context.previous: 夷侯十一年，周宣王即位。

translations.chinese: 釐侯三十九年，周幽王為犬戎所殺，周室卑而東徙。
translations.literal: In Duke Xi's thirty-ninth year, King You of Zhou was killed by the Quan Rong, and the Zhou chamber became lowly and moved east.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xi's thirty-ninth year, King You of Zhou was killed by the Quan Rong, and the Zhou chamber became lowly and moved east.

context.next: 秦始得列為諸侯。

translations.chinese: 秦始得列為諸侯。
translations.literal: Qin began to be ranked as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Shu's great-grandson was called Kang Bo Kun.

context.previous: 釐侯三十九年，周幽王為犬戎所殺，周室卑而東徙。

translations.chinese: 四十八年，釐侯卒，子共侯興立。
translations.literal: In the forty-eighth year, Duke Xi died, and his son Duke Gong Xing ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Eighty years, Kang Bo Kun died.

context.next: 共侯二年卒，子戴侯立。

translations.chinese: 共侯二年卒，子戴侯立。
translations.literal: Duke Gong died in his second year, and his son Duke Dai ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Shu's great-great-grandson was called Kang Bo He.

context.previous: 四十八年，釐侯卒，子共侯興立。
context.next: 戴侯十年卒，子宣侯措父立。

translations.chinese: 戴侯十年卒，子宣侯措父立。
translations.literal: Duke Dai died in his tenth year, and his son Duke Xuan Cuo Fu ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Eighty-seven years, Kang Bo He died.

context.previous: 共侯二年卒，子戴侯立。

translations.chinese: 宣侯二十八年，魯隱公初立。
translations.literal: In Duke Xuan's twenty-eighth year, Duke Yin of Lu first ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Shu's great-great-grandson was called Kang Bo Cheng.

context.next: 三十五年，宣侯卒，子桓侯封人立。

translations.chinese: 三十五年，宣侯卒，子桓侯封人立。
translations.literal: In the thirty-fifth year, Duke Xuan died, and his son Duke Huan Feng Ren ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Ninety-four years, Kang Bo Cheng died.

context.previous: 宣侯二十八年，魯隱公初立。
context.next: 桓侯三年，魯弒其君隱公。

translations.chinese: 桓侯三年，魯弒其君隱公。
translations.literal: In Duke Huan's third year, Lu assassinated their lord Duke Yin.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Shu's great-grandson was called Kang Bo Song.

context.previous: 三十五年，宣侯卒，子桓侯封人立。
context.next: 二十年，桓侯卒，弟哀侯獻舞立。

translations.chinese: 二十年，桓侯卒，弟哀侯獻舞立。
translations.literal: In the twentieth year, Duke Huan died, and his younger brother Duke Ai Xian Wu ascended.
translations.idiomatic: One hundred one years, Kang Bo Song died.

context.previous: 桓侯三年，魯弒其君隱公。

translations.chinese: 哀侯十一年，初，哀侯娶陳，息侯亦娶陳。
translations.literal: In Duke Ai's eleventh year, initially Duke Ai married a woman from Chen, and Duke Xi also married a woman from Chen.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Shu's great-great-grandson was called Kang Bo Tong.

context.next: 息夫人將歸，過蔡，蔡侯不敬。

translations.chinese: 息夫人將歸，過蔡，蔡侯不敬。
translations.literal: The Lady of Xi was about to return home and passed through Cai, but the Duke of Cai was not respectful.
translations.idiomatic: One hundred eight years, Kang Bo Tong died.

context.previous: 哀侯十一年，初，哀侯娶陳，息侯亦娶陳。
context.next: 息侯怒，請楚文王：「來伐我，我求救於蔡，蔡必來，楚因擊之，可以有功。」

translations.chinese: 息侯怒，請楚文王：「來伐我，我求救於蔡，蔡必來，楚因擊之，可以有功。」
translations.literal: Xi Hou angered, invited Chu Wen Wang: 'Come attack me, I will seek help from Cai, Cai must come, Chu therefore strike them, can have merit.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xi was angered and invited King Wen of Chu: 'Come attack me. I will seek help from Cai, and Cai must come. Chu can therefore strike them and gain merit.'

context.previous: 息夫人將歸，過蔡，蔡侯不敬。
context.next: 楚文王從之，虜蔡哀侯以歸。

translations.chinese: 楚文王從之，虜蔡哀侯以歸。
translations.literal: King Wen of Chu followed this and captured Duke Ai of Cai, returning with him.
translations.idiomatic: One hundred fifteen years, Kang Bo Song died.

context.previous: 息侯怒，請楚文王：「來伐我，我求救於蔡，蔡必來，楚因擊之，可以有功。」
context.next: 哀侯留九歲，死於楚。

translations.chinese: 哀侯留九歲，死於楚。
translations.literal: Duke Ai stayed nine years and died in Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Shu's great-great-grandson was called Kang Bo Tong.

context.previous: 楚文王從之，虜蔡哀侯以歸。
context.next: 凡立二十年卒。

translations.chinese: 凡立二十年卒。
translations.literal: He altogether reigned twenty years and died.
translations.idiomatic: One hundred twenty-two years, Kang Bo Tong died.

context.previous: 哀侯留九歲，死於楚。
context.next: 蔡人立其子肸，是為繆侯。

translations.chinese: 蔡人立其子肸，是為繆侯。
translations.literal: The Cai people established his son Xi, who became Duke Mu.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Shu's great-grandson was called Kang Bo Song.

context.previous: 凡立二十年卒。

translations.chinese: 繆侯以其女弟為齊桓公夫人。
translations.literal: Duke Mu made his younger sister the wife of Duke Huan of Qi.
translations.idiomatic: One hundred twenty-nine years, Kang Bo Song died.

context.next: 十八年，齊桓公與蔡女戲船中，夫人蕩舟，桓公止之，不止，公怒，歸蔡女而不絕也。

translations.chinese: 十八年，齊桓公與蔡女戲船中，夫人蕩舟，桓公止之，不止，公怒，歸蔡女而不絕也。
translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Duke Huan of Qi was playing with the Cai woman in the boat. His wife rocked the boat. Duke Huan told her to stop, but she didn't. The duke was angered and returned the Cai woman but didn't divorce her.
translations.idiomatic: Eighteen years, Duke Huan of Qi played with the Cai woman in a boat, the consort rocked the boat, Duke Huan stopped her, she did not stop, the duke was angry, returned the Cai woman but did not divorce her.

context.previous: 繆侯以其女弟為齊桓公夫人。
context.next: 蔡侯怒，嫁其弟。

translations.chinese: 蔡侯怒，嫁其弟。
translations.literal: The Duke of Cai was angered and married off his younger brother.
translations.idiomatic: The Cai lord was angry, married off his younger sister.

context.previous: 十八年，齊桓公與蔡女戲船中，夫人蕩舟，桓公止之，不止，公怒，歸蔡女而不絕也。
context.next: 齊桓公怒，伐蔡；

translations.chinese: 齊桓公怒，伐蔡；
translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong angered, attacked Cai;
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi was angered and attacked Cai;

context.previous: 蔡侯怒，嫁其弟。
context.next: 蔡潰，遂虜繆侯，南至楚邵陵。

translations.chinese: 蔡潰，遂虜繆侯，南至楚邵陵。

translations.literal: In Duke Ling's second year, Chu's Prince Wei assassinated his wang Jia Ao and self-established, becoming King Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ling's second year, Chu's Prince Wei assassinated his wang Jia Ao and self-established, becoming King Ling.

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, King Ling of Chu, because Duke Ling had assassinated his father, lured Duke Ling of Cai to Shen. He hid armored troops and drank with him, got him drunk and killed him, and punished seventy of his soldiers.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, King Ling of Chu, because Duke Ling had assassinated his father, lured Duke Ling of Cai to Shen. He hid armored troops and drank with him, got him drunk and killed him, and punished seventy of his soldiers.

context.previous: 楚使公子棄疾滅陳而有之。

translations.literal: He commanded Prince Qi Ji to surround Cai.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, Duke Jing of Qin died.

context.previous: 十二年，楚靈王以靈侯弒其父，誘蔡靈侯于申，伏甲飲之，醉而殺之，刑其士卒七十人。

translations.literal: In the eleventh month, he extinguished Cai and made Qi Ji the Duke of Cai.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Duke Ai of Qin ascended.

translations.chinese: 楚滅蔡三歲，楚公子棄疾弒其君靈王代立，為平王。
translations.literal: Three years after Chu extinguished Cai, Chu's Prince Qi Ji assassinated his lord King Ling and replaced him, becoming King Ping.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Duke Ai of Qin died.

context.next: 平王乃求蔡景侯少子廬，立之，是為平侯。

translations.chinese: 平王乃求蔡景侯少子廬，立之，是為平侯。
translations.literal: King Ping then sought Cai's Duke Jing's youngest son Lu and established him, who became Duke Ping.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Duke Hui of Qin ascended.

context.previous: 楚滅蔡三歲，楚公子棄疾弒其君靈王代立，為平王。

translations.literal: In this year, Chu also re-established Chen.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Duke Hui of Qin died.

context.previous: 平王乃求蔡景侯少子廬，立之，是為平侯。
context.next: 楚平王初立，欲親諸侯，故復立陳、蔡後。

translations.chinese: 楚平王初立，欲親諸侯，故復立陳、蔡後。
translations.literal: King Ping of Chu had just ascended and desired to be close to the feudal lords, so he re-established the descendants of Chen and Cai.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, Duke Dao of Qin ascended.

context.previous: 是年，楚亦復立陳。

translations.chinese: 平侯九年卒，靈侯般之孫東國攻平侯子而自立，是為悼侯。
translations.literal: Ping Hou ninth year died, Ling Hou Ban's grandson Dong Guo attacked Ping Hou son and self established, this was Dao Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ping died in his ninth year. Duke Ling Ban's grandson Dong Guo attacked Duke Ping's son and self-established, becoming Duke Dao.

context.next: 悼侯父曰隱太子友。

translations.chinese: 悼侯父曰隱太子友。
translations.literal: Duke Dao's father was called the Hidden Crown Prince You.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Duke Ligong of Qin ascended.

context.previous: 平侯九年卒，靈侯般之孫東國攻平侯子而自立，是為悼侯。
context.next: 隱太子友者，靈侯之太子，平侯立而殺隱太子，故平侯卒而隱太子之子東國攻平侯子而代立，是為悼侯。

translations.chinese: 隱太子友者，靈侯之太子，平侯立而殺隱太子，故平侯卒而隱太子之子東國攻平侯子而代立，是為悼侯。
translations.literal: Yin crown prince You was Ling Hou's crown prince, Ping Hou ascended and killed Yin crown prince, therefore Ping Hou died and Yin crown prince's son Dong Guo attacked Ping Hou son and replaced him, this was Dao Hou.
translations.idiomatic: The Hidden Crown Prince You was Duke Ling's crown prince. When Duke Ping ascended, he killed the Hidden Crown Prince. Therefore when Duke Ping died, the Hidden Crown Prince's son Dong Guo attacked Duke Ping's son and replaced him, becoming Duke Dao.

translations.literal: Duke Dao died in his third year, and his younger brother Duke Zhao Shen ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Zao of Qin ascended.

translations.idiomatic: In Duke Zhao's tenth year, he paid court to King Zhao of Chu, holding two beautiful fur coats. He offered one to King Zhao and wore one himself.

translations.chinese: 楚相子常欲之，不與。
translations.literal: Chu's prime minister Zi Chang desired it, but he wouldn't give it.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, Duke Huai of Qin ascended.

context.previous: 昭侯十年，朝楚昭王，持美裘二，獻其一於昭王而自衣其一。

translations.literal: Zi Chang slandered the Duke of Cai and detained him in Chu for three years.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, Duke Huai of Qin died.

translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Cai knew this and then offered his fur coat to Zi Chang;

translations.literal: Zi Chang accepted it and then spoke to return the Duke of Cai.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Duke Ling of Qin died.

context.previous: 蔡侯知之，乃獻其裘於子常；
context.next: 蔡侯歸而之晉，請與晉伐楚。

translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Cai privately with Zhou Chang Hong to seek precedence over Wei;

translations.idiomatic: Wei had its scribe speak of Kang Shu's merits and virtue, and then gave precedence to Wei.

translations.literal: Duke Zhao privately promised and did not consult with the grand officers.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-third year, King Zheng of Qin died.

context.previous: 昭侯私許，不與大夫計。

translations.literal: Twenty-eighth year, Zhao Hou about to pay court at Wu, grand officers feared his again move, then commanded assassin Li kill Zhao Hou;
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Duke Zhao was about to pay court to Wu. The grand officers feared he would move again, so they commanded the assassin Li to kill Duke Zhao;

context.previous: 成侯四年，宋滅曹。

context.previous: 十三年，楚滅陳。

translations.literal: Duke Sheng died in his fifteenth year, and his son Duke Yuan ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-first year, King Zhaoxiang of Qin died.

context.previous: 十九年，成侯卒，子聲侯產立。

translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-second year, King Xiaowen of Qin ascended.

context.previous: 聲侯十五年卒，子元侯立。
